com.dhemery.expressing

Class Expressive

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dhemery.expressing.Evaluations
      • com.dhemery.expressing.Expressive
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ForwardingExpressive

    public abstract class Expressive
extends Evaluations
    Builds fluent expressions to make assertions, evaluate boolean expressions, wait for conditions, and take action when preconditions are met.

    • Constructor Summary

      Expressive()

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • createDefaultTicker

        public abstract Ticker createDefaultTicker()
        Create a new default ticker. This method is called by the eventually() method to obtain a default ticker for polling. The eventually() method is called in two circumstances:
        • When the expression explicitly calls it.
        • When a polling expression does not include a ticker.

        Subclasses must implement this method.

        IMPORTANT: This method must create a new ticker each time it is called.

        Returns:
        a newly constructed default ticker.

      • prepareToPoll

        public Condition prepareToPoll(Condition condition)
        Prepare the condition for polling. This implementation simply returns the condition unenhanced. Subclasses may wish to override this method to enhance the condition before polling. A typical use is to wrap the condition in a PublishingCondition.

      • assertThat

        public void assertThat(Ticker ticker,
              Condition condition)
        Assert that the condition is satisfied during a poll.

        Example:

         Ticker withinTenSeconds = ...;
 Condition launchIsInProgress = ...;
 ...
 assertThat(withinTenSeconds, launchIsInProgress);

      • assertThat

        public <V> void assertThat(Sampler<V> variable,
                  Ticker ticker,
                  org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super V> criteria)
        Assert that a polled sample of the variable satisfies the criteria.

        Example:

         Sampler<Integer> threadCount = ...;
 ...
 assertThat(threadCount, eventually(), is(9));

      • assertThat

        public void assertThat(Ticker ticker,
              Sampler<Boolean> variable)
        Assert that a polled sample of the variable is true.

        Example:

         Sampler<Boolean> theresAFlyInMySoup = ...;
 ...
 assertThat(eventually(), theresAFlyInMySoup);

      • assertThat

        public <S,V> void assertThat(S subject,
                    Feature<? super S,V> feature,
                    Ticker ticker,
                    org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super V> criteria)
        Assert that a polled sample of the feature satisfies the criteria.

        Example:

         Page searchResultsPage = ...;
 Feature<Page,Boolean> resultCount() { ... }
 Ticker withinTenSeconds = ...;
 ...
 assertThat(searchResultsPage, resultCount(), withinTenSeconds, is(greaterThan(9)));

      • assertThat

        public <S> void assertThat(S subject,
                  Ticker ticker,
                  Feature<? super S,Boolean> feature)
        Assert that a polled sample of the feature is true.

        Example:

         Page settingsPage = ...;
 Feature<Page,Boolean> displayed() { ... }
 ...
 assertThat(settingsPage, eventually(), is(displayed()));

      • eventually

        public Ticker eventually()
        Return a new default ticker obtained from this Expressive's helper. This method is named to read nicely in expressions.

        Example:

         View settingsView = ...;
 Feature<View,Boolean> visible() { ... }
 assertThat(settingsView, eventually(), is(visible()));
